name: Moussafir Essaouira Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip around Morocco was very exciting and took us to a number of different hotels. We decided to book the Ibis in Essaouira based on the trip advisor recommendation and we were not disappointed it was lovely!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, would recommend it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a 3 hour bus trip from Agadir it was so nice to arrive to a hotel with friendly reception staff who quickly checked us into our room. On opening the bedroom door I saw a lovely double bed (hard to get in Morocco I have found) with fresh clean white sheets, clean tidy room with flat screen tv on the wall. The bathroom had a lovely large shower and big sink. Looking out my bedroom window I could see a lovely Large pool landscaped all round.
reviews.title: Great hotel !
Good value
reviews.text: The breakfast was great, nice selection of breads, cereal, cheese and other nice things as well. We also had dinner two evening and it was great aswell.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ibis hotel is located about a 10min walk from the beach and 20mins from the town centre. But don’t be put off by this because taxi's are only €0.60 during the day and €1.00 at night to the town centre. It quite out around the Ibis hotel but believe me this is nice after some of the hectic places around Morocco.
reviews.title: Depressing hotel, unhelpful staff, stay in your room if you go here!

likes.disliked: — everything else - no customer service, disgusting shared areas, cold and depressing

reviews.text: I must admit the shower was the best part of the hotel..... However this place is excellent value for money.... €20 per night pp for room only..... What can one expect? It was chosen for this reason and did not dissapoint!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are fine..... don't have breakfast..... be prepared for sterile Ibis decor.
reviews.title: Great new hotel with large swimming pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food isn't the best, so much better to choose from in the area..... breakfast on the beach five mins away is the way to go.... you will not get food poisioning but you will taste better elsewhere...
reviews.title: Value for money, clean, good hot shower, no complaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Value was outstanding and we were a group of 7 loud Irish people and the hotel suited us fine.....
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Brand new Ibis, 5 minutes walk from the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an ok hotel. The rooms are clean and functional but its just the same as any other Ibis I have ever stayed in. You really don't feel like you're in Morocco when staying in this hotel.
reviews.title: Boring, Soulless, Ibis
Couldnt want for more
reviews.text: It takes about 20 - 30 mins to walk to the medina but there are a couple of bars quite close by at the start of the beach.

reviews.title: Quite nice
reviews.text: I know it is hard to find a hotel with a pool in Essaouira but I'd look a little harder and if you have to settle for this then its not awful!

description: Seated at the entrance of the city coming from Marrakech, at 10 mns driving from downtown, 25 mns from the International Airport Mogador and 5 mns from the beach. 151 rooms including 12 communicating rooms and 4 rooms for people with reduced mobility, finely decorated with new Poppy trends and fitted with all modern comfort: heating, air-conditioning, bathroom with shower, LCD television with satellite channels, direct telephone, internet terminal. The Sud & Compagnie Restaurant with a swimming pool terrace offers Mediterranean food, particularly Italian, Spanish, Lebanese or Moroccan dishes.
